subject: Attention:
body:
Attention:
This is to bring to your notice that the status of your payment has
arrived to our department and verification process/due diligence
concluded,a draft bill of 10.5M.USD covering your fund payment have
been approved for transmission.
In line with the agreement signed with the newly inaugurated
government of Nigeria, The Supreme Court will notarize Waiver
Clearance as a legal document (agreement) to remove all expenses
incurred in the course of transmission to your preferred destination.
You are required to pay NOTARIZATION FEE ONLY and court will issue
order to enable bank apply waiver of charges and transmission of your
fund US$10.5M proceed to you without additional costs/fees/charges.
Expecting to receive from you.
Yours Faithfully,
Mr. Alex Alozie,
(Chief Operating Officer)
UNITED BANK FOR AFRICA (UBA)

subject: Re:   Attention:
body:
Hello Mr. Alex Alozie,

Thank you for reaching out to me and providing this information. It's quite interesting to hear about the agreement with the Nigerian government and the Supreme Court's involvement.

Could you please elaborate more on what this payment status means? And what exactly is a 'Waiver Clearance'? I'm not very familiar with these terms, so your explanation would be greatly appreciated.

Also, could you clarify what the fee is for? Is it related to processing or something else?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Vanessa

subject: Re: Waiver Application
body:
Attention:Vanessa,

Your email response is received and content noted. Regards to your
questions, the status  of your payment that arrived our department
shows that you have not received your fund yet and after verification
process/due diligence was concluded, we discovered your fund has been
approved for payment and you are listed as one among beneficiaries due
to receive their duly approved payment hence a draft bill of US$10.5M
covering your fund payment was  approved and signed for onward
transmission as you comply with the instructions in line with the
agreement.

Secondly, the mentioned fee to be paid by you beneficiary is the
NOTARIZATION FEE
 $450. ONLY and court will issue order to enable bank apply waiver of
charges and transmission of your fund US$10.5M proceed to you without
additional costs/fees/charges. Without court notarization, we, the
(issuing bank) cannot apply waiver
until it's notarized by the court as legal document making it official
and binding on the bank to adhere strictly to and never request for
fees of any kind from beneficiary until their fund is successfully
transmitted to them as they may prefer.

The fee can be sent via bank transfer, western union money transfer,
Moneygram/RIA money transfer or any other means of transfer that will
be easier for you beneficiary and that is internationally acceptable.
I shall send you payment instruction based on the means through which
you are sending so I can give you the needed to do the payment, I hope
you understand it? So, you let me know your preferred and easiest
means of sending.

Lastly, waiver implies that all other charges including, taxes levies,
handling charges, processing fees, cost of transfer (COT) etc. will
not be requested from you again once you pay notarization fee for
court to notarize waiver application as legal document (Agreement)
that all other charges be waived for you until you receive your fund.

Expecting to receive from you.

Yours Faithfully,
Mr. Alex Alozie,
(Chief Operating Officer)
UNITED BANK FOR AFRICA (UBA)

subject: Re: Waiver Application
body:
Hello Mr. Alex Alozie,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the time and effort you've put into explaining the situation to me.

I'm a bit confused about some parts of your email though. Could you please clarify what exactly this "waiver" is? And why do I need to pay a fee for it?

Also, could you explain more about these different methods of payment? I'm not very familiar with things like bank transfers or Western Union money transfers.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Vanessa

subject: Re: Waiver Application
body:
Hello Vanessa,

You acknowledged my detailed explanation yet you are a bit confused
about some parts of my email and I ask how confused again?

Waiver in general terms; A waiver is the voluntary relinquishment or
surrender of some known right or privilege. Regulatory agencies of
state departments or the federal government may issue waivers to
exempt companies from certain regulations.

In this context, waiver here means that both government and bank have
surrendered all payments due them before you receive the fund till
after you receive it. Why you need to pay a fee for it is because
waiver can only be effective and legally binding once notarized by a
court of competent jurisdiction and in this context, the supreme court
has the jurisdiction to notarize.

Regarding payment methods, what payment method are you familiar with
if you are not familiar with bank transfers or Western Union money?

Again, you have not forwarded your personal details as requested for
final verification.

subject: Re: Waiver Application
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your detailed explanation about the waiver. It's quite interesting to learn that both the government and bank can exempt payments until after I receive the fund. However, I'm still a bit puzzled about why there is a fee involved in this process. Could you please elaborate more on this?

As for payment methods, I've used bank transfers before but not Western Union money. Is there any specific reason why these two methods are preferred? 

I noticed that you mentioned forwarding personal details. While I understand this might be part of the process, could we perhaps discuss more about the transaction and its details before we proceed with sharing personal information? 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Vanessa

subject: Re: Waiver Application
body:
Hello Mr. Alex Alozie,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the time and effort you've put into explaining the situation to me.

I understand that there is a fee to be paid, which will then allow for a waiver of all other charges. However, I'm not entirely clear on what this fee is for? Could you please elaborate on this?

Also, could you provide more information about the different methods of payment? I'm not very familiar with these types of transactions, so any additional details would be helpful.

Lastly, once the fee is paid and the waiver is in place, how long will it take for me to receive my fund? Is there a specific timeline or does it depend on certain factors?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Vanessa

subject: Re: Waiver Application
body:
Hello Vanessa,

I have explained everything to you in detail and in clear terms. What
is needed now is your receiving information to start processing. You
will receive the fund within 72hrs of working time after receipt of
your payment " NOTARIZATION FEE $450.00 ONLY. This is an official
court fee for Notarization, once the supreme court notarizes the
waiver, it becomes a legal document (Agreement) binding on the bank
and all parties where necessary to apply waiver of any charge that may
arise until you receive fund. Paying for the court to Notarize waiver
also means that you have consented to waiver to receive the fund.

As for payment methods, I don't know the exact one you are not
familiar with but western union money transfers are easy, safe, faster
and convenient and internationally recognized and acceptable means of
transfers of small volume of funds.There are also other means of
sending money which includes bank transfers etc,.

Forward your receiving details as requested with your working  cell
phone number so I can call you for any further explanation you may
need or you can call me on the phone number below. I look forward to
hearing from you today with requested information for onward
proceeding. Congratulations in anticipation.



Yours Faithfully,
Mr. Alex Alozie,
(Chief Operating Officer)
UNITED BANK FOR AFRICA (UBA)
+234 706 265 6564

subject: Re: Waiver Application
body:
Hello Mr. Alex Alozie,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I appreciate the time and effort you've put into this. I'm still trying to understand a few things though, if you don't mind me asking.

You mentioned a payment fee that needs to be made before receiving the fund. Could you please clarify what this fee is for exactly? And why is it necessary?

Also, regarding the method of payment, I'm not very familiar with Western Union money transfers. Could you perhaps explain how it works? Is there any other method that could be used instead?

Lastly, could you please elaborate on what the 'waiver' means in this context? What does it mean to consent to a waiver?

I apologize for all these questions but I just want to make sure I fully understand everything before proceeding further.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Vanessa

subject: Re: Waiver Application (Detailed Explanation)
body:
Hello Mr. Alex Alozie,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I appreciate the time and effort you've put into this. I'm not very familiar with these types of transactions, so please bear with me.

I understand that the fee is for the supreme court to notarize the waiver, which makes it a legal document. That sounds very official and important.

As for payment methods, I've heard of Western Union but never used it before. You mentioned it's easy, safe, faster and convenient - that's good to know! Could you perhaps explain a bit more about how it works? And what about bank transfers? How do they work?

Also, you asked for my receiving details and working cell phone number. Just to clarify, what exactly do you mean by "receiving details"?

Looking forward to your response!

Best wishes,
Vanessa

subject: Re: Waiver Application (Detailed Explanation)
body:
Hello Vanessa,

I have taken my time to explain everything to you in detail and in
clear terms. You should call or send me your cell phone number to call
you for any further clarification and or answer to any other question
you may raise. I believe you will understand much better and fully if
we talk it over.

As for payment methods, I don't know the exact one you are not
familiar with but western union money transfers is one of the foremost
money transfer companies that is globally acceptable, however, I am
never saying, it must be western union as there are other globally
registered and acceptable money transfer companies all over the place
including banks, you can locate any nearest to you and make further
inquiries.

You can also do good to tell me the ones you are familiar with and or
the ones you have sent or received money from. The list of registered
money transfer companies are too numerous to mention, you can check
around you to locate them.

Your receiving details as requested are as below;

1.Full Name: -------------------
2.Home Address:-----------------
3.Phone (Mobile):---------------
4.Occupation: ------------------
5.Copy of Identification:-------
6.Next of kin:------------------
7.Bank Name & Address:----------


These information's shall be certified verifiable by you to be true
and correct without because it shall be registered for legality as the
true details of beneficiary to avoid a counter claim and or delivery
to a wrong person hence it will be used to process the delivery after
court Notarization of waiver

I look forward to hearing from you today with requested information
for onward proceeding. Congratulations in anticipation.


Yours Faithfully,
Mr. Alex Alozie.

subject: Re: Waiver Application (Detailed Explanation)
body:
Hello Mr. Alex Alozie,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's really helpful to understand the process better. I'm not very familiar with Western Union, but I've heard of it before. Are there any other money transfer companies that you would recommend? 

Also, could you please explain a bit more about the court of waiver process? I'm not quite sure what that means.

As for my receiving details, I'm sorry but I don't feel comfortable sharing them over email. Is there another way we can handle this part of the process?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Vanessa

subject: Re: Waiver Application (Detailed Explanation)
body:
Attention:

I have taken time to explain everything to you in details and in
clearer terms that even a layman in the street will understand better.
If you cannot come in person due to distance as you said which shall
be considered as a cogent reason, forward your requested receiving
details as below;

1.Full Name: -------------------

as the true details of beneficiary to avoid a counter claim and or

you supply is safe and secure with us and will be used the purpose of
processing the fund in your favor as the only true beneficiary. If you
cannot do it, then, I am afraid you have to forget and forfeit the
fund as a ghost beneficiary.

What secure online platform are you suggesting by the way?

subject: Re: Waiver Application (Detailed Explanation)
body:

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I appreciate the time and effort you've put into making this clear for me. However, I'm a bit confused about some parts of your message.

Also, could you explain more about the notarized waiver from the court? How does that process work?

As for the secure online platform, I was thinking maybe we could use an established financial institution or a well-known money transfer service. What do you think about that?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Vanessa

subject: Re: Waiver Application (Detailed Explanation)
body:
Attention,
Everything have been fully explained to you. You either come in person
or forward your receiving details as requested for the processing and
delivery of the fund to you. Better still, forget about the fund and
be treated as a ghost beneficiary for onward cancellation which shall
take effect at the end of this first quarter of 2024. Thanks for your
understanding and compliance..
